page.title: 06BEEKEEPING
page.content:
By today's standards, the defined area is a good one for beekeeping. It has a high rainfall, high water table, numerous old meadows and hedgerows, with many small pockets of deciduous woodland. The principal honey flows are:-
May/June Dandelion, sycamore & damson
July Blackberry, clover, willow herb
August Heather from nearby common land
Field beans are an increasing farm cropin the area and will be a useful honey crop in the near future. At present there is one beekeeper in the area keeping 4 colonies of bees.
